channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump urges Congress to make daylight saving time permanent
item.description: President Trump said Congress should "push hard for more Daylight at the end of a day" in a post on Truth Social.

item.title: Trump admin tells judge man wrongly deported to El Salvador is alive, still detained
item.description: On Friday, federal judge Paula Xinis had ordered the Trump administration to provide daily updates to return Kilmar Armando Abrego Garcia to the Unite...

item.title: Gaza hospital hit by Israeli strike, Hamas says
item.description: The group said the attack on Al-Ahli Baptist Hospital was a "horrific crime" committed by Israel, which said it was looking into the reports.

item.title: Police identify victims, including teen, in Boca Raton plane crash
item.description: Police identified the three people killed in a small plane crash in Boca Raton. One other person was injured.

item.title: 4/12: CBS Weekend News
item.description: Idaho teen with autism dies after controversial police shooting; Girls growing the game of hockey with pros cheering them on

item.title: Detective believes 6-year-old's mother was killed in next room while he slept
item.description: For most of his life, Reggie Reed has wondered who murdered his mother Selonia Reed decades ago in Hammond, Louisiana. A fresh look at the evidence ul...

item.title: Plane crash kills at least 1 person in upstate New York, authorities say
item.description: It was unclear as of Saturday what had caused the plane that was carrying six people to crash near Copake, N.Y.

item.title: Divers continue search of Hudson River for helicopter crash wreckage
item.description: Dive teams returned to the Hudson River on Saturday to try to recover the final pieces of wreckage from Thursday's fatal helicopter crash.

item.title: Man mistakenly deported to El Salvador 'alive and secure', US says
item.description: A judge has called for the Trump administration to facilitate the return of Kilmar Abrego Garcia to the US.

item.title: Thousands attend pro-Serbia government rally after months of unrest
item.description: An estimated 50,000 people were there - significantly less than the 325,000 at last month's anti-government protest.

item.title: Trump exempts smartphones and computers from new tariffs
item.description: It follows concerns that tech prices could skyrocket, as many gadgets are made in China, with the US president saying he will give more detail on Mond...

item.title: Indian pot belly: From status symbol to silent killer
item.description: India’s obesity crisis is surging - and the humble pot belly may be a bigger villain than it seems.

item.title: Intellectually disabled teen shot by Idaho police dies after being removed from life support
item.description: An autistic, nonverbal teenage boy who was shot repeatedly by Idaho police from the other side of a chain link fence while he was holding a knife died...

item.title: Big law in Trump's crosshairs
item.description: For weeks, President Trump has been targeting certain law firms with executive orders. Some have fought back, but others have cut deals to avoid the d...

item.title: Smartphones and computers are now spared from Trump's reciprocal tariffs
item.description: The exemption comes amid worries of how President Trump's steep new tariffs will affect American tech companies that rely on supply chains in China, l...

item.title: Judge relaxes ban on DOGE access to sensitive US Treasury information
Lawyers for Sean ‘Diddy’ Combs want jurors at trial questioned about sex, drugs and violence
Trump administration says it will exclude some electronics from reciprocal tariffs
item.description: The Trump administration says it will exclude electronics like smartphones and laptops from reciprocal tariffs, a move that could help keep the prices...
